author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Friday announced a slew of concessions, including a hike in pension schemes and promotion for government employees. In a suo motu statement in the Assembly, Ms. Jayalalithaa said the assistance given to the legal heir of a government employee in the event of death under the family welfare scheme would be increased from Rs 1.5 lakh to Rs 3 lakh.

Accordingly, the monthly amount deducted from the salary of the government employee would be hiked from Rs. 30 to Rs. 60. It would cost the government an additional Rs. six crore.

She also hiked the sum assured under the group insurance scheme for employees of government-aided schools, nutritious meal scheme, local bodies and village panchayats from Rs. 1.5 lakh to Rs. 3 lakh.

Ms. Jayalalithaa said the government would issue an order for regularising the services of employees appointed on compassionate grounds.

“In normal course, those who are appointed on compassionate grounds are eligible for a pay hike and other benefits only after their services are regularised. Since it required the nod of the Tamil Nadu Public Services Commission (TNPSC), regularisation of their services got delayed. The government will issue an order for regularisation of services of those who do not require relaxation of rules. Till the TNPSC’s nod is obtained, they will be treated as temporary employees,” Ms. Jayalalithaa said.

As far as the employees of anganwadi and nutritious meal scheme are concerned, their monthly pension will be increased from Rs. 1,000 to Rs. 1,500.
title: Slew of concessions for T.N. govt. staff
